attribute-definition.description: This attribute will be set as true if the customer have opted for ship to collection point
paymentMethod used by shopper
This represents the UUID of the product line item that holds the qualifying product.
Renders an alternative URL in main navigation. Uses Commerce Cloud content url notation. For example: $url('Account-Show')$ or normal URL http://xchange.demandware.com
Used to define the content asset used to populate a category style rendering template.
Use this attribute to apply custom styles for this category.

attribute-definition.display-name: Display Shop All Link in Mobile
attribute-definition.description: When enabled will show "Shop All <category_name>" link in mobile navigation.
When enabled for a category, the subcategories of this category will be displayed in dropdown menu.
Expects a category ID. The canonical tag for this category's product listing page will be set to the URL of the given category if it exists and is online.
Checking this box enables the noindex tag. ONLY use if the page should not be indexed by Search Engines.

Used to define if/when the Compare feature is to be visualized in the storefront based on navigation. If enableCompare = FALSE, no Compare checkboxes will be displayed in the grid view. If enableCompare = TRUE, the category (and its children) will support the Compare feature.
Customer Experience Type, Outlet|Premium
Which way to orient the menu and optional header menu HTML. Vertical will list all in one line. Horizontal will list in columns.

attribute-definition.display-name: Hide Sub Categories In Category Menu

attribute-definition.description: Used to define a mobile override.

Used to indicate that a category (such as Mens -> Footwear -> Boots) will display in the roll-over navigation. A sub-category only shows if also the parent category is marked as showInMenu. Up to three category levels are shown in roll-over navigation.

Used to define the content asset ID of the Size Chart that is appropriate for products whose PRIMARY category is the associated category (and its children). Whenever a product detail page (or quick view) is rendered, the Size Chart link is populated based on the value of this attribute for the products primary categorization. If not defined, NO size chart link is displayed.
Image used on either the top or bottom slot on the category landing pages.
Display the “Choose a fit model” drop down menu on this category PLP. Enable the “Fit Model” experience on this PLP.
Use this attribute to apply custom styles for this content asset.

Status of Confirmation Sent to Borderfree
attribute-definition.description:
Not mandatory.
Possible values:
Unconfirmed - Order is created, but no confirmation sent
Confirmed - Confirmation has been sent to Borderfree
Timeout - Timeout error during sending confirmation, will be retried 1 more time
Error - Error sending confirmation to Borderfree. Will not be retried automtically.
The Borderfree merchantOrderRef field used to link SFCC orders to BFX orders.
The ID of the order in Borderfree's system (also referred to as e4XOrderId sometimes)
JSON object containing all parcels and their status for tracking communication to Borderfree via Shipment Notification API
The date when we last updated the shipping status

attribute-definition.display-name: Master Quantity Limit Per Order (only for master products)
attribute-definition.description: By adding a value to this attribute, we limit the quantity a customer can order for all variations assigned to this master. Locales and Currencies Data
All notifications for BV-related DW job schedules will be sent to this email address.
The key to be used to initialize SEO objects.
The name of the client to be used in the naming of the ratings, product, and purchase feeds.
This setting is important for initializing the Cloud SEO object. Defaults to "Main Site".
Enables the Questions and Answers Module.
Enables BV Pixel.
Enables the Ratings and Reviews module.
The specific Bazaarvoice environment from which to pull data. Values are 'Staging' or 'Production'

Colon separated value pairs that define how DW Locales are mapped to BV Locales. DW Locales must be enabled in the current DW Site. BV Locales must be enabled within your BV platform account. Format: ["(DW Locale ID)":]"(BV Locale)"

The image type and size to be used in the purchase feed. Values include "small", "medium", "large". If "small" is selected, but there is no small image, "medium" will be the default value. If no "medium" image exists, no image will be exported for that product.

The image type and size to be used in the product feed. Values include “small”, “medium”, “large”. If “small” is selected, but there is no small image, “medium” will be the default image. If no “medium” image exists, no image will be exported for that product.

The event which triggers the Purchase Feed. If "shipping" is selected, then the purchase feed will only include shipped orders. If "purchase" is selected, the feed will contain all orders flagged for export.
This setting controls if the user will see Rating “Stars” or a rating summary at a glance.
If set, then it will use the Site Name as a prefix for categories in the purchase and product feeds.
Enable formatting of product IDs in the following manner: "SiteName"-"ProductId"
The additional product family to be exported in the Product Feed. Comma-separated list of multiple values: UPC,EAN,MPN where MPN is manufacturer part number.
If set, then it will use the Site Name as a prefix for products in the purchase and product feeds.
This setting affects the Product ID to be included in the ratings, product and purchase feeds.
BV Product Types to exclude from transactions.
If XML Feed is selected, removes the customer's email from BV Pixel.
Enable case insensitive product ID for Inline Ratings Import job.
comma separated list
When true, this causes a TLS check to take place based on whether or not a cookie ('dw_TLSWarning') has been set on the browser
If true, some debug information about the current request context is written to the HTML as comment

The hostname of the CoreMedia Preview CAE (without protocol and path)

attribute-definition.display-name: Remain Registered Customers On Current Page
attribute-definition.description: Remain Registered Customers On Current Page
Is loyalty enabled
If true, displays the “Add to Apple Wallet” and/or “Add to Google Wallet” buttons on the storefront.

If enabled, once every 30 days a customer's "REDEEMED" which are not in the active cart will be reverted. This helps recover a customer's points if a coupon was deleted with a system cart expiration event.
If pilot is enabled then check the ZIPs, if it is false then Loyalty is enabled for all areas and no check of the ZIPs is needed.
Loyalty pilot zip codes. Example: 10001;10002;10003;

attribute-definition.display-name: DomainId - Aurus domain ID for identify respective iFrame, CSS for different Domain
attribute-definition.description: This field identifies the Aurus provided 3-digit Domain identification number. Aurus will provide Domain ID for identify respective iFrame, CSS for different Domain.
Use in WalletObject for Aurus PayPal

attribute-definition.display-name: MerchantIdentifier - identifies the Aurus provided merchant identification number
attribute-definition.description: This field identifies the Aurus provided merchant identification number. Every merchant registered with Aurus must have this value in order to process any financial/non-financial transactions. Public merchant identifier is used only for token transaction and private merchant identifier is used for charging the card. Both the merchant identifier would be unique.

attribute-definition.display-name: StoreId - identifies the Aurus provided 5-12 digit variable length merchant identification number
attribute-definition.description: This field identifies the Aurus provided 5-12 digit variable length merchant identification number. Every merchant registered with Aurus must have this value in order to process any financial/non-financial transactions.

This field identifies the Aurus provided 8-digit terminal identification number. Every merchant registered with Aurus must have this value in order to process any financial/non-financial transactions. One store can have multiple terminals assigned to it.

attribute-definition.display-name: TerminalId - Aurus terminal identification number for Andriod
attribute-definition.description: This field identifies the Aurus provided 8-digit terminal identification number. Every merchant registered with Aurus must have this value in order to process any financial/non-financial transactions. One store can have multiple terminals assigned to it.

attribute-definition.display-name: TerminalId - Aurus terminal identification number for IOS
attribute-definition.description: This field identifies the Aurus provided 8-digit terminal identification number. Every merchant registered with Aurus must have this value in order to process any financial/non-financial transactions. One store can have multiple terminals assigned to it.

attribute-definition.display-name: URLType - URL Type for identify respective Aurus iFrame
attribute-definition.description: This field identifies the Aurus provided 3-digit URL Type. Aurus will provide URL Type for identify respective iFrame, CSS for different Domain. 1-Iframe, 2-JS, 3- paypage, 4-Alternate Payment
